chat_history.name: attraction_search

chat_history.content:
# Day 1 (March 13th) - Palm Springs to Houston

- Take the 6:07 am flight (Flight F3839339) from Palm Springs to Houston. The flight will cost you $282 and will take 2 hours and 52 minutes.
- Arrive in Houston at 10:59 am.
- Check into your accommodation. I found a few options for accommodation in Houston:
   - A Superhost 3-bedroom apartment that costs $746 per night and does not allow pets.
   - A private room for $488 per night which allows visitors and pets.
   - A private room for $259 per night that allows pets, but not smoking and can accommodate one person.
- Visit the Houston Museum of Natural Science, which is approximately a 14-minute drive from your accommodation. The museum offers an immersive experience in the natural world and is open until 5 pm.
- Enjoy dinner at Jalapenos, a restaurant with an average cost of $57, serving desserts, tea, cafe, Chinese, and seafood cuisine.

# Day 2 (March 14th) - Houston

- After breakfast, visit the Downtown Aquarium, a popular attraction located in the heart of Houston.
- In the afternoon, visit the Houston Zoo, a renowned zoo with a wide variety of animals and exhibits.
- For lunch, try Earthen Spices, a restaurant with an average cost of $28, offering a diverse menu that includes tea, Mexican cuisine, bakery, BBQ, and fast food.
- In the evening, visit the Space Center Houston, which is approximately a 42-minute drive from your accommodation. It offers a fascinating insight into space exploration.
- Enjoy a late dinner at The BrewMaster - The Mix Fine Dine, a restaurant with an average cost of $52, serving French, Indian, cafe, and seafood cuisine.

# Day 3 (March 15th) - Houston

- After breakfast, explore the Gerald D. Hines Waterwall Park, located near your accommodation.
- Visit the Holocaust Museum Houston, which is about a 12-minute drive from your accommodation.
- Enjoy lunch at Chawla's宊, a restaurant with an average cost of $26, offering Chinese, desserts, bakery, cafe, and Mediterranean cuisine.
- In the afternoon, head to the Pioneer Memorial Obelisk, an iconic landmark located in Hermann Park.
- For dinner, try Subway, a restaurant with an average cost of $51, serving tea, bakery, desserts, and seafood.

# Day 4 (March 16th) - Houston to Austin

- Take the 9:44 am flight (Flight F3911595) from Houston to Austin. The flight will cost you $47 and will take 48 minutes.
- Arrive in Austin at 10:41 am.
- Check into your accommodation. I found a few options for accommodation in Austin:
   - A cozy room in South Harlem, costing $564 per night and allowing visitors, but not children under 10.
   - A spacious one-bedroom apartment in Williamsburg for $455 per night, accommodating 2 people.
   - A beautiful 3-bedroom apartment in East Williamsburg for $1169 per night, allowing visitors and accommodating up to 7 people.
- Visit the Texas Capitol, a historic landmark located in downtown Austin.
- Enjoy lunch at Wildflour Cafe + Bakery, a restaurant with an average cost of $55, offering desserts, French cuisine, bakery, BBQ, and seafood.
- In the afternoon, explore the Museum of the Weird, a unique museum located in the vibrant 6th Street District.
- For dinner, try Mehfil-e-Handi, a restaurant with an average cost of $96, serving desserts, tea, bakery, American, and seafood cuisine.

# Day 5 (March 17th) - Austin

- After breakfast, visit the Austin Zoo, a wildlife sanctuary known for its diverse animal collection.
- Explore the Cathedral of Junk, a unique art installation made entirely from recycled materials.
- Enjoy lunch at The Kasbah, a restaurant with an average cost of $88, serving cafe, pizza, BBQ, and fast food cuisine.
- In the afternoon, visit the Austin Nature & Science Center, a destination for learning about nature and science.
- For dinner, try Cup-a-licious, a restaurant with an average cost of $85, offering fast food, Chinese, BBQ, Italian, and pizza.

# Day 6 (March 18th) - Austin to Dallas

- Take the 13:11 am flight (Flight F3601655) from Austin to Dallas. The flight will cost you $90 and will take 1 hour and 18 minutes.
- Arrive in Dallas at 14:29 pm.
- Check into your accommodation. I found a few options for accommodation in Dallas:
   - A cozy private room near the Empire State Building for $231 per night that allows visitors, but not smoking or children under 10.
   - A 1-bedroom apartment with an elevator and kitchen for $475 per night, accommodating 3 people.
   - A luxurious duplex in Williamsburg for $241 per night, allowing visitors and accommodating up to 5 people.
- Visit the Dallas World Aquarium, a popular attraction located in the heart of Dallas.
- Enjoy dinner at Coconuts Fish Cafe, a restaurant with an average cost of $38, offering cafe, BBQ, Mediterranean, and fast food cuisine.

# Day 7 (March 19th) - Dallas to Palm Springs

- After breakfast, visit the Dallas Zoo, a renowned zoo with a wide variety of animal species and exhibits.
- In the afternoon, explore the Dallas Arboretum and Botanical Garden, a lush green space with beautiful flora and fauna.
- Enjoy lunch at 1918 Bistro & Grill, a restaurant with an average cost of $90, serving tea, pizza, BBQ, and seafood.
- Take the 12:29 pm flight (Flight F3710304) from Dallas to Palm Springs. The flight will cost you $451 and will take 3 hours and 22 minutes.
- Arrive in Palm Springs at 3:51 pm.

This itinerary provides a well-rounded experience of Houston, Austin, and Dallas, with a balance of sightseeing, cultural exploration, and culinary delights. The total estimated cost for this trip, including flights and accommodation, is $5,978, which is well within your budget of $8,100. The remaining budget can be used for additional activities, meals, and transportation within the cities.

functions.name: accommodation_search
functions.desc:
Discover accommodations in your desired city.
Example: accommodation_search("Rome") would present a list of hotel rooms in Rome.

city.description: The name of the city where you're seeking accommodation.

functions.name: attraction_search
functions.desc:
Find attractions in a city of your choice.
Example: attraction_search("London") would return attractions in London.

city.description: The name of the city where you're seeking attractions.

functions.name: city_search
functions.desc:
Find cities in a state of your choice.
Example: city_search("California") would return cities in California.

state.description: The name of the state where you're seeking cities.

functions.name: flight_search
functions.desc:
A flight information retrieval tool.
Example: flight_search("New York", "London", "2022-10-01") would fetch flights from New York to London on October 1, 2022.

departure_city.description: The city you'll be flying out from.

destination_city.description: The city you aim to reach.

date.description: The date of your travel in YYYY-MM-DD format.

functions.name: google_distance_matrix
functions.desc:
Estimate the distance, time and cost between two cities.
Example: google_distance_matrix("Paris", "Lyon", "self-driving") would provide driving distance, time and cost between Paris and Lyon.

origin.description: The departure city of your journey.

destination.description: The destination city of your journey.

functions.name: restaurant_search
functions.desc:
Explore dining options in a city of your choice.
Example: restaurant_search("Tokyo") would show a curated list of restaurants in Tokyo.

city.description: The name of the city where you're seeking restaurants.

functions.name: submit_day_plan
functions.desc:
Once you have collected information about the trip, call this function once for each day of the trip, starting on day 1.
If a field does not apply for a given day, use "-" to indicate this.
You MUST call this function to save the plan for each query.

current_city.description: The city for this day. If the plan is to travel between two cities, indicate it as "from A to B" (e.g. "from Ithaca to Charlotte").

transportation.description: e.g. "Flight Number: F3633413, from Ithaca to Charlotte, Departure Time: 05:38, Arrival Time: 07:46"

breakfast.description: The name of a restaurant in the city, e.g. "Nagaland's Kitchen, Charlotte"

attraction.description: Use a ";" to separate different attractions, with each attraction formatted as "Name, City". e.g. "The Charlotte Museum of History, Charlotte;"

accommodation.description: e.g. "Affordable Spacious Refurbished Room in Bushwick!, Charlotte"
